comments.commentBody: Boo! The Jaguars get zero respect nationally (including here), but that doesn't mean their fans are apathetic. Those who have been watching have noticed the Jags have suffered no TV blackouts this season. Plenty of other teams, including the Chargers and Raiders, certainly can't say that.
Bravo Mr. Gautaullin.  I will look at your pictures many times to appreciate them and learn from them.  I must say I knew it was film after just 3 or 4 pix, pretty obvious I thought.   Keep shooting!

One anomaly of the scoring system is that McShane and Anand had a materially better rating performance than Carlsen...assuming players also have an eye on their rating it isn't quite as simple as saying the players just sought to maxcimise their tournament score...Anand has finished behind Carlsen but in the process strengthened his position as the no.1 rated player in the world ahead of the tournament winner. This system therefore undermines the integrity of the rating system, which assumes a normal distribution of results. Perhaps the games should not be rated at all by FIDE given the bias that is being introduced.

"The main effect of giving more for a win than two draws is to motivate riskier play ..."

As a fan, this sounds right to me. Somehow I recall a 13-year-old Bobby Fischer sacrificing a Queen against Donald Byrne. I don't think he was playing for a draw.
Horace Mann is the worst educational institution, I can't believe they came out winning, there must have been some cheating going on!

comments.userDisplayName: Variations on a Theme of Paul
comments.commentBody: If I know Walt like I think I know Walt, he'll watch the whole game, score be damned. Say what you will, the man is a true Jets fan. I admire his loyalty.
I enjoy Mike Tanier's writing very much. Terrific stuff.
Good lord - is that the same Mike Hoffman who scored a handful of goals for the 1989 Hartford Whalers?  Is that possible?
they'd do better showing that fight in coventry cut in with the song.  'e deserves to be beat to 'ell for that...Great League.

Far out... Ya gotta love it.

Best wishes to the Belfast Giants.
Greta Gerwig did a wonderful job. She should definitely get nominated. I can't believe Greenberg got snubbed at the Golden Globes!

What is the real problem with these new productions? Why wouldn't people want to experience something that surprises and challenges them, especially when they've paid so much for a ticket? Why wouldn't people want a cultural product to be relevant and novel and risky?  And if the problem is the lack of a specific type of scenery -- if you're mainly there for the music anyway, why does it matter so much? What do you demand of opera's spectacle? These are real questions, and I'd be very interested to hear from people who decry "Eurotrash." Please explain your point of view more fully.
I guess your have to be citizen of another country to stand up to the new right wing theocracy in America.

Does Eric Braeden know who know Neil Patrick Harris is? NPH has been acting since he was 15 years old. He has been a working actor for 22 years, has starred in two network sitcoms, worked with Stephen Sondheim and I am not sure there is a voice over job or hosting gig he has not taken. On that note who is Eric Braeden?

If you're still traveling to Nutcrackers please consider...
www.COBALTDANCE.org
Lancaster, PA

http://articles.lancasteronline.com...
Contact Kay Byrnes if interested in seeing a performance Dec 18, 19 or 20th.
717 394-2024 kebyrnes@comcast.net

COBALT Dance Company's Nutcracker really is different! Funny and fast-paced, Shari Vegso-Wilson, Kristin Pontz, Heather Bare, Cody Smith specially designed it to entertain your whole family--- boys and girls alike (yes, boys!), from youngsters to "highly experienced." I bet you haven't seen anything like it.

Its true--the original choreography is steeped in the dance traditions of classical ballet and great American modern dance, and the young dancers are exceptionally gifted technically. But you don't need to care about that to really "get" it! Just don't blink! You might miss something!

So if you're ready to take a breather from your hectic pace at this time of year, click the link below for tickets and join us at Franklin & Marshall's Roschel Performing Arts Center this weekend. COBALT's Nutcracker will become a memory that will delight you. These dancers aspire to dance on New York City stages and stages around the world.

EXTRAORDINARY DANCE HOMEGROWN IN LANCASTER COUNTY
COBALT DANCE COMPANY
NUTCRACKER !
Call now 1-888-71-TICKETS or reserve online at CobaltDance.org

Don't miss this opportunity to experience the singular joy of dance with your family and friends...vibrant classical and contemporary choreography shows Tchaikovsky's uplifting music in a whole new light!

If I were Neil Patrick Harris, I would be careful. Everyone knows that Eric Braeden built the super computer COLOSSUS, which controls the world. He also killed Zira and Cornelius, the apes from the future. So he can be a pretty dangerous guy.

If I were Neil Patrick Harris, I would probably learn to keep my mouth shut.

I hope many other voices join Mr. Bronson's and withdraw their works.  The Smithsonian has shown incredible cowardice in its actions.  It should pay for it by having a gallery emptied not by fear-mongers and bigots but by the artists themselves, well before the scheduled closing.

" ... after it was criticized by the religious right. "

Dear Ms. Taylor, since when did the Catholic League become a "religious right" ???
How easy it is for you to arbitrarily assign labels !
Wow.  That is a haunting photograph.

Why do successful small off Broadway shows move to Broadway when they are doing well where they are?  While I realy did not like Scottsboro Boys, it certainly deserved a much longer run.  Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson has the same problem (although I really liked this one).  It should have stayed in a small off-Bway house and maybe it would have found a nice cult following.  I think it is a combination of greed and ego that keeps these kinds of mistakes happening.
Bravo, I say!
What A ROYAL marvel this motion picture was, and remains. I swoon EVERY TIME Fred Astaire breaths, and that elegent attire, and the cigaarette smoke, and the checkered floors....I;m IN HEAVEN!!
Send it back and shut him up!
I feel grief at this profound loss to Hollywood. This man;s work speaks volumes, I maintain!

Google's "Books Ngram Viewer" is another free online tool that allows us to visualize information in new ways. I explore how to use the tool in the classroom to help students better understand the research method in my blog post - "How To Quantify Culture? Explore 500 Billion Published Words With Google's Ngram Viewer" http://bit.ly/gcKJdp

PS - Ngram includes an Easter Egg - Search for "never gonna give you up" and see what pops up!
